info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 23 at 12:33PM CDT until September 23 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Huntsville AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of north central Alabama, including the following counties, Limestone and Madison and southern middle Tennessee, including the following county, Lincoln.
* WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1226 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated runoff due to heavy rain from thunderstorms over portions of Limestone and Madison counties in Alabama as well as southern Lincoln County in Tennessee. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen, with little additional rain anticipated over the next few hours. - Emergency Management has reported water over roads in northwest Madison County, with at least one road in barricaded. Please make sure to heed local officials and do not drive around barricades. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntsville, Madison, Athens, Fayetteville, Meridianville, Moores Mill, Redstone Arsenal, Hazel Green, Ardmore, Harvest, Alabama A And M University, University Of Alabama In Huntsville, New Market, Tanner, Lincoln, Elkmont, Toney, Elkwood, Taft and Capshaw. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING

area.areaDesc: Limestone, AL; Madison, AL; Lincoln, TN
